document_data.name: Bolifar Geldert
document_data.mainbody: '''Bolifar Geldert''' was a [[War Wizard]] of [[Cormyr]].{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|78-80|5}}
document_data.Description: He was old, bony, and customarily stooped.
document_data.Personality: He considered himself studious, careful, and a hard worker, though he was doddering in his old age.
document_data.Possessions: At the time of his disappearance, he carried a writing satchel.
document_data.History: On Alturiak of {{yearlink|1365}},{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|2|Realmslore}} Bolifar Geldert requested an out-of-the-way room to compile a report for [[Vangerdahast]] about the activities of the minor [[Cordallar]] noble family of [[Cormyr]]. He was given the keys to a room by [[Sardyl Crownsilver]], and went missing hours afterwards, without any sign of activity whatsoever.
document_data.Death: After his death, once all other tools were exhausted, Vangerdahast called on [[Elminster Aumar]], who recognized the telltale traces of a [[trapper]] having been in the room to eat someone, and remembered that the magical map on the wall was actually a ''[[portal]]''. Vangerdahast realized there and then that the Master of Beasts, [[Kaulgetharr Drell]], must have helped kill the War Wizard; they were soon attacked by [[Baerune Cordallar]], who tried to ambush them from the portal.{{cite book/Elminster in Hell/Hardcover 2001|85-89|5}}
